metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3606 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the PSOutputDev::doImageL1Sep function in Xpdf before 3.02pl4, and Poppler 0.x, as used in kdegraphics KPDF, might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF document that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> poppler fixes this with the gmallocn cleanups in CVE-2009-3605

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
xpdf package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
